Zen Rogue XuanLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 07 Jul 2019Hi OP,Congrats on taking charge of your financial journey. I would suggest that you read up Shiny Things e-book to better understand how your journey will be. A brief summary can be found here: https://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/money-mind-210/things-i-learnt-shiny-things-money-mind-5248645.htmlAs per his recommendations, for Singapore side, you can consider buying  ES3 & A35
For overseas,  Vanguard & iShares etfs are the way to go as the fees are very low. Some ETF would be  VWRD/VWRL,VUSDThere are a few ways you can go about buying ETFs/Stocks, with the key objective is to lower fees.
